newsitem.title: POLAND: NFI units to start OTC trade June 13.
newsitem.headline: NFI units to start OTC trade June 13.

text.p: Polish mass privatisation units, currently listed on the Warsaw bourse, will start over-the-counter trade on June 13, the company running the Polish OTC market said in a statement on Friday.
CeTO said the units would be traded in blocks of 10.
The units represent participation in Poland's mass privatisation programme, where 15 NFIs were given controling stakes in more than 500 medium-size companies.
Each fund, run by international managers, was given a leading, 33 percent stake in more than 30 companies and small equity stakes in the remaining firms.
From May 12, the 26 million Poles who bought participation units in the scheme have been entitled to exchange them for 15 shares, one in each fund.
The funds will start bourse trade on June 12.
